source.bac84fb8:
import os
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
sns.set(style='darkgrid')

from warnings import filterwarnings
filterwarnings('ignore')

df_age=pd.read_csv('../input/indonesian-covid19-dataset/Age.csv')
df_conf=pd.read_csv('../input/indonesian-covid19-dataset/Case Confirmed.csv')
df_death=pd.read_csv('../input/indonesian-covid19-dataset/Death.csv')
df_province=pd.read_csv('../input/indonesian-covid19-dataset/Province.csv')
df_rec=pd.read_csv('../input/indonesian-covid19-dataset/Recovery.csv')
df_sex=pd.read_csv('../input/indonesian-covid19-dataset/Sexual.csv')

print("Shape of df_age : ", df_age.shape)
print("Shape of df_conf : ", df_conf.shape)
print("Shape of df_death : ", df_death.shape)
print("Shape of df_province : ", df_province.shape)
print("Shape of df_rec : ", df_rec.shape)
print("Shape of df_sex : ", df_sex.shape)
source.92aebe06:
label=list(df_age.columns[1:])
plt.figure(figsize=(16,4))
plt.suptitle("Agewise Distribution of Covid Cases", fontsize=18)
for i,key in enumerate(df_age["key"].unique()):
    plt.subplot(1,4,i+1)
    plt.title(key)
    x=df_age[df_age.key==key].iloc[:,1:].values[0]
    plt.pie(x=x,labels=label, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=0)
plt.show()
source.0b34ec73:
label=list(df_sex.columns[1:3])
plt.figure(figsize=(16,4))
plt.suptitle("Gender wise Distribution of Covid Cases", fontsize=18)
for i,key in enumerate(df_sex["key"].unique()):
    plt.subplot(1,4,i+1)
    plt.title(key)
    x=df_sex[df_sex.key==key].iloc[:,1:3].values[0]
    plt.pie(x=x,labels=label, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=0)
plt.show()
source.ad14856a:
for key in df_province.columns[1:5]:
    plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
    plt.title(f"Province wise : {str(key)}", fontsize=16)
    sns.barplot('Province',key, data=df_province)
    plt.xticks(rotation=80)
    plt.show
source.e763a8f6:
mr=round(df_province.Death.sum()*100/df_province.Case.sum(),2)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
plt.title(f"Province wise : Mortality Rate", fontsize=16)
sns.barplot('Province','Mortality Rate', data=df_province)
plt.axhline(y=mr,color='k', label="National Mortality Rate")
plt.legend(['National Mortality Rate'])
plt.xticks(rotation=80)
plt.show()
source.0b8d3e60:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,4))
plt.title("Daily Time Series", fontsize=16)
sns.lineplot(df_conf.index, 'Case', data=df_conf,color='blue', label="Confirmed")
sns.barplot(df_conf.index, 'In Care', data=df_conf,color='red', label="Active")
sns.lineplot(df_conf.index, 'Death', color='black', data=df_conf, label="Deaths")
sns.lineplot(df_conf.index, 'Recovery', data=df_conf,color='green', label="Recovery")
plt.xlabel("Days since first case")
plt.ylabel("Number of Cases")
plt.legend()
plt.show()
source.a4b1b177:
df_conf['Case_C']=df_conf['Case']
df_conf['In Care_C']=df_conf['In Care']
df_conf['Death_C']=df_conf['Death']
df_conf['Recovery_C']=df_conf['Recovery']

for i in range(1, df_conf.shape[0]):
    df_conf['Case_C'][i]=df_conf['Case'][i]+df_conf['Case_C'][i-1]
    df_conf['In Care_C'][i]=df_conf['In Care'][i]+df_conf['In Care_C'][i-1]
    df_conf['Death_C'][i]=df_conf['Death'][i]+df_conf['Death_C'][i-1]
    df_conf['Recovery_C'][i]=df_conf['Recovery'][i]+df_conf['Recovery_C'][i-1]
source.49e5f512:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.title("Cumulative Time Series", fontsize=16)
sns.lineplot(df_conf.index, 'Case_C', data=df_conf,color='blue', label="Confirmed")
sns.lineplot(df_conf.index, 'In Care_C', data=df_conf,color='red', label="Active")
sns.lineplot(df_conf.index, 'Death_C', color='black', data=df_conf, label="Deaths")
sns.lineplot(df_conf.index, 'Recovery_C', data=df_conf,color='green', label="Recovery")
plt.xlabel("Days since first case")
plt.ylabel("Number of Cases")
plt.legend()
plt.show()
source.052a60f1:
The data provides age wise segmentation of Positive, In Care, Recovery and Deaths reported.
Column 29-Oct to be renamed as agegroup 10-29
source.07eb10d9:
Observation:
* Around 80% of the cases are reported in the agegroup 30-69.
* Agegroup 0-9 is practically immune to the infection.
* Recovery is higher for agegroups 10-49.
* Age group 50+ is most vulnerable, contributing around 80% of deaths with only around 40% of cases.
